title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Neurodegeneration may emerge in football players earlier than previously thought
items.description: Even in athletes without chronic traumatic encephalopathy, brain tissue showed neuron loss and other changes, though their significance isn’t clear

items.title: Scientists make most authentic kidney replicas so far
items.description: Lab-grown organoids reproduce some of a kidney's internal structure and function

items.title: Notorious ex–weapons factory will lock up nuclear waste in glass—if the White House lets it
items.description: Hanford vitrification plant set to open but some fear Trump officials are pushing for a cheaper alternative

items.title: House panels charge U.S. National Academies with producing partisan studies
items.description: Pending spending bill urges agencies to find other sources of scientific advice

items.title: After bizarre journey, prized history of molecular biology archive finds new home
items.description: Science History Institute makes public multimillion-dollar collection, including Rosalind Franklin’s famous DNA image, assembled by fake scientist

items.title: Scientists decry NIH pledge to end some human fetal tissue research
items.description: Move could signal return to ban on such studies imposed by first Trump administration

items.title: Satellites could reveal the secret burial grounds of Mexico’s murder victims
items.description: Sensors can detect chemical clues invisible to the human eye

items.title: Gold-covered hairballs may reveal why cats eat grass
items.description: Spiky projections on plant matter may act like “drain snakes,” helping felines dislodge wads of fur

items.title: Far more authors use AI to write science papers than admit it, publisher reports
items.description: Finding highlights promise, questions about detectors of AI-generated text

items.title: NIH kicks off yearlong effort to modernize biosafety policies
items.description: New initiative leaves researchers with questions about details and scope
